title: Strictly's Stacey Dooley begs Mike Bushell not to quit after sickening abuse from trolls

Strictly's Stacey Dooley has begged BBC's Mike Bushell not to quit the dancing show after he was bombarded with abuse from trolls and got a sickening death threat.

The 2018 champion, 32, took to Twitter on Monday to show support for the BBC presenter, 53, as he was chosen by judges to stay in the dancing competition over Catherine Tyldesley and her partner Johannes Radebe.

Stacey hit back at trolls for him, and told fans that they're missing the point of the show by telling Mike to quit because he isn't the best dancer.

She tweeted: "No one loves Johannes more than me.

"But those telling Mike to quit, have totally missed the spirit of Strictly

"What kind of message do you send, quitting, because you aren't the best? Ridiculous.

"We love you Mike."

Mike's wife Emily jumped in to thank Stacey for showing support to her disheartened husband.

"Thank you @StaceyDooley for bringing perspective and support," she wrote with a kiss emoji as sweet gesture.

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: Twitter)

Mirror Online excluisvely revealed Mike had been sent a chilling death threat warning him to quit the dance competition or be a "dead man".

The threat ordering him to pull out of the contest before this Saturday's show has left the BBC star and wife shocked.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Speaking at the Pride of Britain Awards, Mike, told us: "It said that unless I withdraw from the competition now I'm a dead man.

"It was personal and I thought WTF. There are bigger things in the world to worry about.

"I get that people have their own favourite dancers but it's an entertainment show at the end of the day and to get a death threat is ridiculous.

(Image: PA)

"My wife saw it first and when I went to see who had sent it, they had already removed the tweet. A death threat? What?! On Strictly?

"You rise above it but it's people being cowardly isn't it?

"The show is meant to be happy, make people feel happy."
description: The former Strictly star has begged pal Mike not to quit the show in midst of troll abuse
